meanings.definition: The SI unit of electrical capacitance, equal to one coulomb per volt.
meanings.sent1: A farads measures how much electricity a device can store.
meanings.sent2: The capacitor has a capacitance of 10 farads.
meanings.sent3: Why did the capacitor break up with the resistor? Because it couldn't handle the farads of commitment!
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like a farads, storing all the memories they shared.
meanings.sent5: The farads of the capacitor were so high, it could power the entire city for a day.

meanings.definition: A unit of electrical charge equal to one coulomb per volt.
meanings.sent1: The circuit required a specific amount of farads to function properly.
meanings.sent2: He measured the charge in farads to determine the voltage.
meanings.sent3: Why did the electron bring a suitcase to the party? To carry its farads!
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like a farads, building up until it was ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: The farads in the battery were slowly depleting, indicating the need for a recharge.
